concept.title: Wheel Maintenance and Bearing Function
concept.shortdesc: Understanding proper wheel operation and bearing maintenance for optimal vehicle performance.

section.title: Wheel Testing
section.p: Regular wheel testing involves checking for both smooth rotation and proper side play. A properly functioning wheel should come to rest with the tire valve positioned directly below the hub after spinning.

Signs of bearing problems include:
Sharp clicking sounds during wheel rotation
Momentary wheel hesitation during spinning

section.title: Bearing Care
section.p:
Hub bearing wear commonly results from two primary factors:
Insufficient lubrication
Excessive friction caused by overtightened adjusting cones

Proper bearing maintenance requires:
Regular cleaning of the bearings
Maintaining adequate grease in the hub
Prompt removal of damaged bearing components to prevent complete bearing failure
